sen.j: 御池通（おいけどおり）は京都市の主要な東西の通りの一つ。
sen.e: The Oike-dori Street is one of the major east-west running streets in Kyoto city, Kyoto Prefecture.
Oike-dori Street is one of the major east-west streets in Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Oike-dori Street is one of the major east-west thoroughfares in Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: Kyoto Prefecture原文にないので削除

sen.j: 京都市の中心に位置する中京区の中央部を横断し、川端通 - 堀川通間は京都市内で最も通りの幅が広い。
sen.e: The street, running across the central part of Nakagyo Ward located in central Kyoto City, has the widest section of the city from Kawabata-dori Street to the Horikawa-dori Street.
The street, which runs through the central part of Nakagyo ward in central Kyoto City, has the widest section of the city from Kawabata-dori Street to the Horikawa-dori Street.
The street, which runs through the central part of Nakagyo Ward in central Kyoto City, has the widest section in the city from Kawabata-dori Street to the Horikawa-dori Street.

sen.j: 京都市営地下鉄の京都市営地下鉄東西線が走っている。
sen.e: The Tozai Line of Kyoto Municipal Subway/Kyoto City Subway runs below it.
sen.cmt: http://www.city.kyoto.jp/koho/eng/access/transport.htmlhttp://www.city.kyoto.jp/kotsu/tikadia/tikatime.htm路線図には"Kyoto City Subway Line"と表記一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Tozai Line of Kyoto Municipal Subway/Kyoto City Subway runs below it.
The Tozai Line of Kyoto Municipal Subway/Kyoto City Subway runs below it.

sen.j: 平安京の三条坊門小路にあたる。
sen.e: It corresponds to the Sanjo-bomon-koji Street in Heiankyo.
It corresponds to Sanjo-bomon-koji Street in Heiankyo.
It corresponds to Sanjo-bomon-koji Street in Heiankyo.

sen.j: 東は川端通から西は太秦の天神川通までの4.9キロメートルであるが、途中二条駅で分断されている。
sen.e: The 49 kilometer long street, extending from the Kawabata Street in the east to the Tenjingawa-dori Street at Uzumasa in the west, is divided by Nijo Station on its way.
The 49-kilometer street, extending from Kawabata Street in the east to Tenjingawa-dori Street at Uzumasa in the west, is at one point bisected by Nijo Station.
The 4.9-kilometer street, extending from Kawabata Street in the east to Tenjingawa-dori Street at Uzumasa in the west, is at one point bisected by Nijo Station.

sen.j: 神泉苑の傍を通るため、この名前になったというが、江戸時代初期の1665年（寛文5年）発行の地誌「京雀」には「【三条坊門通】この筋を東にては八幡町通と云、…、西にては御池通と云、此筋室町に御池町あり、むかし鴨居殿とて御所あり、鴨の下居池の井ありける跡也とかや」とある。
sen.e: Although some say that the name “Oike” originates from a nearby pond of Shinsenen, but a topography titled "Kyo Suzume" (Kyoto saprrow) says, "This Sanjo Bomondono street is called Hachimancho-dori in the east, …Oike-dori in the west as there was Oikecho at Muromachi on this street. Long ago the Imperial Palace "Kamoidono (palace of ducks)" was there and it had the pond with ducks. This place is supposed to be.”

Although some say the name “Oike” originates from a nearby pond of Shinsenen, a topography titled "Kyo Suzume" (Kyoto sparrow) says, "This Sanjo Bomondono street is called Hachimancho-dori in the east, …Oike-dori in the west, as there was Oikecho at Muromachi on this street; long ago the Imperial Palace "Kamoidono (palace of ducks)" was there, and it had the pond with ducks; this place is supposed to be.”

Although some say the name Oike originates from a nearby pond of Shinsenen, a topography titled 'Kyo Suzume' (Kyoto sparrow) published in 1665 says, 'This Sanjo Bomondono street is called Hachimancho-dori in the east, …Oike-dori in the west, as there was Oikecho at Muromachi on this street; long ago the Imperial Palace Kamoidono (palace of ducks) was there, and it had the pond with ducks; this place is supposed to be.'
sen.cmt: 原文に『』のない" "を削除原文の「」にあわせて"を'に「1665年（寛文5年）発行」を補足

sen.j: 今も烏丸御池付近には「御池之町」「龍池町」「二条殿町」の地名が残る。
sen.e: The place names of “Karasuma Oike”, “Tatsuikecho,” and “Nijodencho” have remained around Karasuma Oike.
The place names of “Karasuma Oike," “Tatsuikecho” and “Nijodencho” have remained around Karasuma Oike.
The place names of 'Oikenomachi,' 'Tatsuikecho' and 'Nijodencho' have remained around Karasuma Oike.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」にあわせて"を'にKarasuma Oike→Oikenomachi

sen.j: 池も含めて二条殿の地は、二条家の邸跡で、織田信長の「二条新御所（二条城）」の故地でもある。
sen.e: The site of Nijodono having this pond was once a mansion owned by the Nijo family and originally Nijo New Imperial Palace (Nijo Castle) built for Nobunaga Oda.
The site of Nijodono, having this pond, was once a mansion owned by the Nijo family, which was originally the Nijo New Imperial Palace (Nijo Castle) built for Nobunaga Oda.
The site of Nijodono, having this pond, was once a mansion owned by the Nijo family, which was originally the Nijo New Imperial Palace (Nijo Castle) built for Nobunaga ODA.

sen.j: 「御池通神泉苑起源説」は近来興った説で、「二条殿御池起源説」に従うべきだろう。
sen.e: The Oike-dori named after "Shinsenen" theory have grown recently and may have to give way to the Oike-dori named after "Nijodono Oike" theory.
The theory of Oike-dori named after the "Shinsenen" has faded recently and may have to give way to the theory of Oike-dori named after the "Nijodono Oike."
The theory of Oike-dori named after the Shinsenen has emerged recently and may have to give way to the theory of Oike-dori as named after the Nijodono Oike.

sen.j: 室町通御池上ルには「二条殿御池跡」の碑も現存する。
sen.e: A monument of “the site of Nijodono Oike” has remained at Muromachi-dori Oike Agaru.
A monument of “the site of Nijodono Oike” remains at Muromachi-dori Oike Agaru.
A monument of 'the site of Nijodono Oike' remains at Muromachi-dori Oike Agaru.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」にあわせて"を'に

sen.j: 東端の区間である川端通から堀川通の間は、第二次世界大戦時に沿道にあった家屋を防火帯として強制疎開させた跡なので、8車線の広い通りとなっている。
sen.e: The eastern end section, between the Kawabata-dori Street and the Horikawa-dori Street, is 8-lane wide street because, during World War II, houses along the street were forced to move to create a fire blocking belt.

The eastern-end section between Kawabata-dori Street and Horikawa-dori Street is eight lanes wide because, during World War II, houses along the street were forced to move in order to create a fire-blocking belt.

The eastern-end section between Kawabata-dori Street and Horikawa-dori Street is eight lanes wide because, during World War II, houses along the street were forced to move in order to create a fire-blocking belt.

sen.j: かつて当該区間には側道があり、中央分離帯及び側道分離帯には1953年以降に植樹され大きく成長した212本のケヤキの街路樹もあった。
sen.e: This section having side roads was lined with 212 tall grown zelkova trees, which had been planted along the median strip and the side divider in 1953 or later.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This section having side roads was lined with 212 tall, fully grown zelkova trees, which were planted along the median strip and the side divider in 1953 or later.
This section having side roads was lined with 212 tall, fully grown zelkova trees, which were planted along the median strip and the side divider in 1953 or later.

sen.j: しかし、地下鉄東西線建設工事を控えて1990年 - 1991年に撤去され、梅小路公園へ移植された。
sen.e: However, between 1990 and 1991, the trees were moved to Umekoji Park before the construction work of the subway Tozai Ｌine.
However, between 1990 and 1991 the trees were moved to Umekoji Park before the construction work of the Tozai Subway Ｌine.
However, between 1990 and 1991 the trees were moved to Umekoji Park before the construction work of the Tozai Subway Ｌine.

sen.j: 現在では、道路照明灯、信号機、南北方向の交差道路の標柱などのデザインが統一されている。
sen.e: Today in this section, street lights, traffic lights, and signs for guiding the north-south roads of are of unified design.
Today in this section, the streetlights, traffic lights and signs guiding travelers to the north-south roads are of a unified design.
Today in this section, the streetlights, traffic lights and signs guiding travelers to the north-south roads are of a unified design.

sen.j: このデザインはGK Kyotoが担当した。
sen.e: GK Kyoto made this design.
GK Kyoto made this design.
GK Kyoto made this design.

sen.j: 分離帯を撤去して車道を中央に寄せたことで、歩道が拡幅された。
sen.e: The sidewalks have been widened because the dividers were removed and the driving lanes were laid out in the center.
The sidewalks have been widened because the dividers were removed and the traffic lanes were laid out in the center.
The sidewalks have been widened because the dividers were removed and the traffic lanes were laid out in the center.

sen.j: 歩道の車道寄りには新たにケヤキ223本が植え直されたが、以前の立派な街路樹とは比べるべくもなく、成長するには20年以上かかる。
sen.e: New 223 zelkova trees have been planted along the street between the sidewalk and the driving lane but are still incomparable with the previous excellent roadside trees: it will take more than 20 years for the trees to grow high.

Two hundred and twenty-three new zelkova trees have been planted along the street between the sidewalk and the driving lane, but they are still incomparable with the previous excellent roadside trees; it will take more than 20 years for the new trees to grow as tall.

Two hundred and twenty-three new zelkova trees have been planted along the street between the sidewalk and the driving lane, but they are still incomparable with the previous excellent roadside trees; it will take more than 20 years for the new trees to grow as tall.

sen.j: 京都市役所前には地下街や市営地下駐車場が整備されている。
sen.e: There are an underground shopping center and a city-run underground parking area at Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae.
There is an underground shopping center, along with a city-run underground parking area, at Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae.
There is an underground shopping center, along with a city-run underground parking area, at Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae.

sen.j: 祇園祭の山鉾巡行の経路の一部となっているほか、各種のイベントでは交通規制してパレードなども行われる。
sen.e: The street is a part of the route for Yamahoko Junko (procession of Gion Festival Floats) and, in addition, parades in a variety of events are held with traffic shot down.
The street is part of the route for Yamahoko Junko (procession of Gion Festival Floats) and, in addition, parades for a variety of events are held with the flow of traffic shut down.
The street is part of the route for Yamahoko Junko (procession of Gion Festival Floats) and, in addition, parades for a variety of events are held with the flow of traffic shut down.

sen.j: 地下鉄東西線の京都市役所前駅／烏丸御池駅／二条城前駅の3つの鉄道駅がある。
sen.e: There are 3 railway stations along the street; Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae Station, Karasuma Oike Station, and Nijojo-mae Station of the Subway Tozai Line.
There are three railway stations along the street: Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae Station, Karasuma Oike Station, and Nijojo-mae Station of the Subway Tozai Line.
There are three railway stations along the street: Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae Station, Karasuma Oike Station, and Nijojo-mae Station of the Subway Tozai Line.

tit.e: Between Horikawa-dori Street and East Exit of Nijo Station
Between Horikawa-dori Street and the east exit of Nijo Station

sen.j: 狭くなり2車線である。
sen.e: The street is narrower with 2 lanes.
The street is narrower, having two lanes.
The street is narrower, having two lanes.

sen.j: 迂回路としてすぐ北側に並行する押小路通が4車線の広い通りになっており、地下鉄東西線もこの区間では北に逸れて押小路通の地下を通っている。
sen.e: The Oshikoji-dori Street paralleling just north is wider with 4 lanes and serves as a detour, and the Subway Tozai Line is also off the street northward to run under the Oshikoji-dori Street in this section.

Oshikoji-dori Street, which runs parallel just north, is wider with four lanes and serves as a detour; moreover, the Subway Tozai Line is also off the street northward and runs through this section under Oshikoji-dori Street.

Oshikoji-dori Street, which runs parallel just north, is wider with four lanes and serves as a detour; moreover, the Subway Tozai Line is also off the street northward and runs through this section under Oshikoji-dori Street.

tit.e: Between Nijo Station West Exit and Sanjo-dori Street
Between Nijo Station West Exit and Sanjo-dori Street
Between Nijo Station West Exit and Sanjo-dori Street

sen.j: もとは狭い通りで二条駅により東側部分と分断されていた。
sen.e: The street was once narrow and separated from its eastern section by Nijo Station.
The street was once narrow and separated from its eastern section by Nijo Station.
The street was once narrow and separated from its eastern section by Nijo Station.

sen.j: 山陰本線連続立体交差と、二条駅再開発に伴い拡幅工事が進んで4車線になり、押小路通と接続された。
sen.e: With the construction of the continuous multi-level crossing of the Sanin Main Line as well as road widening works in the redevelopment project of Nijo Station, the street has got 4 lanes and connected to the Oshikoji-dori Street.

With the construction of the continuous multi-level crossing of the Sanin Main Line as well as road widening work in the redevelopment of Nijo Station, the street has four lanes and is connected to Oshikoji-dori Street.

With the construction of the continuous multi-level crossing of the Sanin Main Line as well as road widening work in the redevelopment of Nijo Station, the street has four lanes and is connected to Oshikoji-dori Street.

sen.j: 地下では地下鉄東西線の延伸工事がなされ2008年1月16日に太秦天神川駅まで開業した。
sen.e: Underground, with the completion of the construction works, the subway Tozai Line was extended to Uzumasa Tenjin Station January 16, 2008..
Underground, with the completion of construction, the Tozai Subway Line was officially extended to Uzumasa Tenjin Station on January 16, 2008.
Underground, with the completion of construction, the Tozai Subway Line was officially extended to Uzumasa Tenjingawa Station on January 16, 2008.

sen.j: 途中、西大路通との交差地点に西大路御池駅も設置された。
sen.e: Nishioji-dori Oike Station was opened halfway at the crossing with the Nishioji-dori Street.
Nishioji-dori Oike Station was opened halfway at the crossing with Nishioji-dori Street.
Nishioji-dori Oike Station was opened halfway at the crossing with Nishioji-dori Street.

sen.j: 同時に地上部分の舗装も進み、御池通も天神川通を越えて太秦天神川駅前ターミナル、さらに西の三条通へと交差する形となった。
sen.e: At the same time, construction works on the ground continued and, as the result, the Oike-dori Street now runs over the Tenjingawa-dori Street and Uzumasa-tenjingawa-ekimae Terminal, and further goes west to cross the Sanjo Street.
sen.cmt: http://www.city.kyoto.jp/html/kotsu/busdia/hyperdia/u.htm「舗装」は、建設工事としました。
sen.e: At the same time, construction work on the ground continued, and as a result Oike-dori Street now runs over Tenjingawa-dori Street and Uzumasa-tenjingawa-ekimae Terminal, and goes west to cross Sanjo Street.

At the same time, construction work on the ground continued, and as a result Oike-dori Street now runs over Tenjingawa-dori Street and Uzumasa-tenjingawa-ekimae Terminal, and goes west to cross Sanjo Street.

sen.j: 三条通と御池通は旧市街地内では平行して走る東西の道路であるが、三条通が西大路通以西でやや北西に傾くため交差することとなる。
sen.e: The Sanjo-dori Street and the Oike-dori Street parallel east and west in the inner city, but, in the west of the Nishioji-dori Street, the Sanjo-dori Street turns moderately northwest causing the two streets to intersect.

Sanjo-dori Street and Oike-dori Street run parallel east and west in the inner city, but in the west of Nishioji-dori Street, Sanjo-dori Street turns moderately northwest, causing the two streets to intersect.

Sanjo-dori Street and Oike-dori Street run parallel east and west in the inner city, but in the west of Nishioji-dori Street, Sanjo-dori Street turns moderately northwest, causing the two streets to intersect.

sen.j: 御池通と三条通の交差点名は、京都市地理に従い「三条御池」と名付けられた。
sen.e: The crossing between the Oike-dori Street and the Sanjo-dori Street was named “Sanjo-oike” according to the common practice of naming streets in Kyoto City.
The crossing between Oike-dori Street and Sanjo-dori Street was called “Sanjo-oike,” according to the common practice of naming streets in Kyoto City.
